u0A6GNkcAUof0JsGAXp4Qw.text: Bland.  My "hot" bean curd was anything but--had to cover it in sriracha.  My husband's hot and sour soup was nothing like any hot and sour he'd ever had (and not in a good way).  The mushrooms looked canned and the chicken in the hot & sour soup was oddly rubbery.  This place over Americanizes their food and it makes me miss east coast Chinese.  We're keeping our hopes up that we'll find "our" Chinese take out place in Phoenix, but the outlook isn't good if Dragon Palace is worthy of 4 stars! One up side: ridiculous amount of food for a really good price.

harCyAp9-Y_KLfYMWGJ7HA.text: I have been going here since I was a kid and it has always been delicious!  It is tucked away in the corner so don't miss it!  It is my favorite Chinese food ever.  I have tried several Chinese food places and while they all are pretty good nothing compares to Dragon Palace.

8wvDX09lSmD2ZvemVo__ow.text: Best Chinese I've had in a long time! This place was recommended to us by the owner of Hammered Hog, and I don't think I will try another Chinese place in the Valley. The service was excellent, fast, friendly and patient (sometimes I take a long time to decide what I want to eat). The food was outstanding. The Won Ton soup had excellent flavor and lots of Shrimp! I ordered the Happy Family - a favorite of mine from when I lived in NY. This is the first place I have found in the 16 years that I have lived in Phoenix that actually makes it like they do back East. My son ordered the Mongolian beef - another perfectly prepared dish. Dave got the House Special Chicken -great flavor - crispy and juicy. I also love Fried Rice - again, great flavor, huge portion. All the portions were large, the price was reasonable and the service absolutely fantastic! The only downfall - no delivery. :-(   They have been in business for 33 years - and I know why they will continue to be there for another 30!  I suggest you go there now!

ykyxWizUeiK7Rj33tZxLhQ.text: Wow! For the money ( about $35 for two), the best chinese food in town, no doubt. The only thing is that the actual dinner for two could feed at least four.  Wouldn't go to eat in the area but we've seen the reviews on this place and decided to give it a try - it was worth it 100%.

0dDJwsc3RZx5GxwD6p9tKA.text: Dragon Palace has been my family's go-to Chinese food place since before I was born, so it will always have a special place in my heart. I think I had my birthday dinner here for at least 10 birthdays in a row. Nothing changes in Dragon Palace-- the menu, the decor, the workers all seem stuck in a time warp in the strip mall's corner. But that's what makes it awesome! I will always remember the teal walls and the red booths.   Ok, enough reminiscing. Food- you should get the hot bean curd. It's listed in the vegetarian section, which is a total lie because it involves a lot of pork. But man it is tasty, and spicy! Tofu magic! The mushu vegetable wraps with plum sauce are also delicious and a waiter will come to your table and make them for you, which is fun to watch. Also, the free tea is awesome! It just adds to the whole experience.   Definitely a long time Phoenix establishment, don't be fooled by the boring outside, go check it out!

bHR_EBo-HvdeVHdpAG0IZw.text: Just went there for dinner with my husband, Sunday night, not too busy. Service was ok. We ordered dumplings and teriyaki beef sticks as appetizers, it was pretty good. Then came the entrees, pork fried rice was just ok (some rice not fully cooked at the bottom of the plate) Crispy duck .... $13 entree to get a bunch of pieces of over fried duck put on a plate, mostly fried skin and bones. They cut the bites with the bones in it, so you either have to pull the meat off or spit the bones chunks out as you're chewing on it... I was so disappointed after a good start with the appetizers. Won't go back, overpriced. Still on the hunt for a good Chinese food place.

SOdy5-EO2DiTZAgjsvhimA.text: So we decided to try somewhere new and lets just say I just have stuck with the bad reviews... it was disgusting the chicken was barely chewable even my lkids didnt like what they ate.. the crab puffs had like a pinch of stuff in the middle there was hardly anything in there we ordered the seseme chicken which may have been the best of the 3 things, then we ordered  the sweet and sour which was horrible and my poor husbands teryaki chicken was a runny disgusting mess.. we will not order from here again..

uJ5vlTj6tOIr0_k4kfDCLQ.text: Let me just say I am not going to use words like throw-back( except I am spelling it correctly unlike our reviewer down below...) or retro to describe Dragon Palace. Let's be honest and say that it has looked just about entirely the same since the place opened, about 30 years ago.   More positively I get greeted like family upon entering,( and I'm not Chinese either - Im a Korean who does not eat Korean food, and there's no inside jokes with the owner)  the service seems to always be good. I have grown up eating at this restaurant for years and can even remember being a little kid and craving their egg rolls. So good.   For those that were disappointed, did you forget that everyone on yelp thinks they are the next up and coming food critic and is extremely opinionated about their experience throwing in the quintessential yelp review words such as ambience or atmosphere all the while possibly mistaking outdated decor for intentional sarcasm? Or are you a picky eater? Or did you expect an overseasoned dish ala PF Chang's?   The food here is plain and simple. The bathroom is clean but could also be mistaken for one in a dive bar as well. The water in the bathroom faucet is insanely hot as the handwritten note warns.I am quite the drinker, but I don't go here for my drinks. I go here for delicious and salty Chinese food. I love the hot tea here, so my cocktail can wait until later.   Go for lunch, it's ridiculously affordable. You will leave full.   This is what I order:   (I don't mind that there is a small sized splash of what appears to be soy sauce on the zigzag border that sits just above the wood paneling in the booth. It seems like it has been there since my 10th Birthday anyway)    Egg drop soup. I like a thicker broth, this is the best. It gets better when you take your first bite  and there are fresh veggies like onion, red bell pepper and tofu in the soup. The fried wontons they serve with it make it even better. If I order egg drop soup anywhere else I immediately regret it, and crave this. It is definitely more egg-y than watery, but that's how I like it.   I only eat egg rolls from here. The wrapper is fried to crisp perfection Their hot mustard is the best anywhere in my personal opinion.   House Special Chicken( all white meat for only 50cents) Crab puffs, Shrimp and Snow Peas, Lemon Chicken, Almond Chicken, and The Mongolian Beef, are some of my most favorites, and they are safe bets.   Also, it says they don't cater, but my Dad just got remarried and they let us order enough food for 100 people with advance notice which was really nice.

xFOYACGBJFuu1CDwOcUqNA.text: Look no further for an awesome Chinese food fix. Service is quick without frills-as one would be accustomed to in a restaurant serving this kind of food-but is great tasting and portions are more than anyone could ever expect to eat-so plenty to bring home.

71PussBN9DZsBRkuwdaKew.text: Very welcoming and friendly owners. Lunch specials are awesome price and very tasty. They give soup egg roll and hot tea with your choice of entree. Its always hot fresh and a lot of food. We are there once a week if not more. You will be too :)

QYLweaCo1sH6GsmSyEAHZQ.text: Great place for Chinese food! Prices are fair and always has great service. Have been going here for years! It could use a bit of updating but the food is always good. Delivery service would be awesome!

lriDY9SMWBViJW3mS4KNzQ.text: Stopped in last night and grabbed some food to go.  I read all the great yelp reviews and decided to try it.   Loved the meat dumplings!!  I usually don't like dumplings but theirs were great!!  We also had the honey dipped chicken.  That was my favorite.  They are like little drumsticks covered in a honey sauce.  They were so good.  I wasn't a big fan of the chow mien noodles but everything else was yummy!!  I want to try their dessert next time- the fried banana....looks delicious

Id5XeEdxWX6mzgidaG-ZpQ.text: My wife and I tried takeout at Dragon Palace a few weeks ago and were really pleased. We ordered one of their specials, the house beef, and it was AWESOME! It honestly got better with every bite and we talked about it for days. We also got the hot n sour soup but frankly it was neither hot nor sour, but somewhat tasty (wouldn't order again).  We went back the other night and dined in and got the happy family---which was delicious and the seafood in it was cooked to perfection---and the Mongolian beef, which was also tasty and tender. We also tried a couple more soups and neither of us loved any of them---just missing something. Probably stay away from the soups going forward to focus on better stuff.  I love spicy food and my request for a chili sauce or hot sauce was answered with a funky paste of mostly seeds that had absolutely zero heat level to it---and I mean zero. I just wanted something like sriracha to kick it up and they apparently don't have that and in my opinion should.  Everyone was polite and friendly, and the owner (assumed it was the owner) walked around and asked how things were and thanked us---which by the way---many "fine dining" restaurants fail to do and it is so simple and leaves an impression.  We will definitely return to Dragon Palace. It's not PF Chang's in terms of atmosphere but when you want good food and don't feel like a big hassle this is the place.

CTMcbpqxvVWPXXzBWIII9A.text: I have been craving authentic Chinese food for awhile now and this definitely hit the spot.  Excellent food and great service. This definitely just became one of my favorite places to go.

G5y6SRYUyIUvHAgUNxi9lg.text: Sizzling rice soup is a must. There isn't a bad thing on the menu, been eating here for over 20 years.

6NIXud_NZGb_3tZIsfCGJw.text: This is one of our favorite Chinese restaurants  in town. Over the years I have probably had everything on the menu. The sizzling rice soup is the best I've had. I usually have one of the shrimp dishes, my favorite being the Kung Pao Shrimp.

HM8nfKRBM_zaxCnDapRelg.text: I came here for dinner a few weeks ago after reading the reviews on yelp.  I was pretty disappointed and won't be going back.  I got a cup of the wonton soup as an appetizer - it was pretty pathetic.  The wontons had a dime-sized amount of meat in each one, and the broth was awful.  I got sesame chicken and wasn't impressed with that either.    To top it off, the family that owns the place let their small child run around the entire restaurant and in and out of the kitchen screaming, with the teenaged hostess (also a family member) hardly bothering to try to quiet her down.  The waitress just went and sat at a table next to the kitchen staring at me the whole time.  What the heck?  Atmosphere gets a zero.

u6t66NinrGW0nR2t6LeKrw.text: 5 Stars for "Old School"   Americanized Chinese food, in an authentic  funky retro Chinese restaurant environment.  Fresh, flavorful, and priced right.    My husband and I were sans children, and wanted something close to home, but different than our usual haunts.  Based on the Yelp reviews, I decided to give Dragon Palace a try.    What a great find!  I have seen this place before, when at the Quiltz shop at the end of the little strip center.  I am glad to try any hole in the wall or oddball place, but having had too much bad Chinese in the past, will usually not try one unless it comes with a recommendation by someone.    Hot tea and ice water arrived immediately.  We ordered 2 Dragon Dinner Specials- I the Almond Chicken, my husband the Mongolian Beef.  Evil, delicious little crunchy fried wonton strips showed up after we placed the order.  The Wor-Wonton soup arrived first- hot, and delicious. Beautiful clean shrimp were so flavorful, and the veggies and wontons were perfect.    The eggrolls were crisp and fresh.  The chicken drumette was crisp and flavorful.   Our entrees were so good, reminding me of the old fashioned Chinese restaurants I went to with my parents in late 60's-early 70's.  (Anyone remember Toy's Shangri La??)       Service was pleasant and non-obtrusive.  Here's an observation I made:  there was NO HINT of anything that had been frozen and added back into any dish.  I hate it when places do this!  The only downside was that we got NO banana wonton desserts!  I think it was because we arrived around 8:15 and they closed at 9, and were closing up the kitchen.  Now we HAVE to go back so we can try some other entrees and those little sweet morsels.

t4NHPxaktuq9YCm1V-nh_w.text: Menu looks like every single chinese takeout place on the east coast and they aren't pretentious.  Clearly I'm not in California anymore.  Fantastic.  This place made me pretty dang happy.  It's rot gut chinese.  Boom.

O3wbHxW4kCyNWScJDK8c6w.text: I have been going here since I was a child (and it hasn't changed at all). I loved it then and I still love it now.  My favorite dishes are the Mongolian Beef and Almond Chicken, but they have plenty of other great dishes. They have a great lunch menu and very generous portions. Come hungry. Their dinners are served family style. The restaurant is a little dark and could use some new, updated decor.  Be sure to check out the huge mural on the north wall.

fKHNcGNXPF-T5kt1Q9s84w.text: Bring your appetite. They feed you like your starving. Staff was on point with what you expect from a chinese restaurant. Food just as good, chicken was a bit dry but spot on for flavor. Mongolian Beef was perfect.  We did the peking family meal. And the Zombie drinks were great. Planning to make this our goto for chinese food. With tip whole meal came to $60ish for 2. Now onto home for a food coma.

PFdnAf_tbFgoDCLcvLzGXA.text: I tried Dragon Palace after reading rave reviews here on Yelp. I rate three stars as I found the food okay but not great. The cuisine is Cantonese and I prefer dishes from the Sichuan province. I like a steamed dumpling and all Dragon offers are fried dumplings. I've had fried dumplings before at other restaurants and there are usually light fry marks on the dumpling's wrapper. The dumplings at Dragon seemed to be fried in a deep fat fryer. They were ok -- a bit on the heavy and greasy side. The House Special Beef was probably the best of the three entrees we ordered. The beef was VERY tender. The red pepper sauce that was served on the side was quite tasty. The Mongolian Beef was a bit flat and the Sesame Chicken seemed to be pieces of pre-fried chicken you'd get from Costco in the frozen section. Again, these seemed deep fried and not with a light, sticky coating that I prefer. The sauce was super sweet and lacked flavor. Also, Sesame Chicken is usually served with broccoli and this came with no vegetable.   I enjoyed the Chinese decor including lanterns with a spinning cylinder my grandmother used to have. Very Chinatown-ish as were the murals. However the bar area was very cluttered and seemed to be used partly for takeout box storage. The restaurant needs to de-clutter. It looked like health department certificates (home printed) were taped on a wall behind the cash register. Not good. Those should be trashed as well as the coin vending machines in the lobby.   This all said, the service was good, friendly and fast.   I like there is a pot of hot tea on the table. The fried banana strips at the end are also a nice touch.   Overall, Dragon Palace could use a lot of sprucing up and decluttering inside and dishes that offer a little more flavor. Not sure if I will return.

8KL_AIh--gIlQINdRTtnIQ.text: We literally order Chinese food once a year because, well, you know... it isn't the most healthy opiton out there. BUT!!! My good Lord is it delicious. Enter Dragon Palace. Very friendly staff, amazing food. Don't be deterred by the sketch strip mall - give this place a try.

yxfSYQ_uJjjIpbAKYEfByw.text: Great food! Kids LOVED it too. They are picky.   Would have got 5 stars, but the service is rude. Been there a couple of times and they always rush you out. If you are talking to others at your table they will interrupt and ask if your done with your plate. lol. I've had them literally take plate before I set fork down to finish bite in my mouth. They literally stand and watch you eat and yes, quick on refills, but also pushy to get you out.   I'm not use to it. It's so uncomfortable to have them stare, push, and grab food out from under you.   The music and atmosphere is nice, just wish you could relax and enjoy it and not feel unwanted there. So strange.

7ADocghXVmZ3--WvMis4qw.text: I have been going here for 20 years. I am never disappointed, they have the best Hot and Sour soup I have ever had. I have moved to California and every time I come back to Phoenix I always stop in for my fix. The family that owns and runs Dragon Palace are kind and always remember me even when it has been 6 months since my last visit. I always feel welcome they always have a smile and genuine interest in my satisfaction with the meal. Great service, great menu and great prices make this one of my favorite meal spots in Phoenix.

Y9-Tv7qQ9mhuzoSGeCxNWQ.text: This is my go to Chinese takeout. I love their food and the service is great. I have a huge family so we order a lot of food and it's ready in 15 minutes. They are very kind and polite.

HrpUTslC8C3icEgaDD6oIw.text: More authentic than places like Panda Express, but definitely not somewhere I'd go for quality Chinese food. I went with a big group and we ordered a variety of dishes off the menu. Overall their prices are low, but their food is rather one-dimensional. And they drench almost all of their dishes in thick sauces, making them feel greasy and unhealthy.  While the service is good and they have a lot of seating for large groups, the food is nothing more than something cheap and filling.

WSdWGDGuezgTLpndRV_7YQ.text: Their Chicken fried rice and egg rolls are the best in the Valley!! We have been going their for 20+ years and the food is always sooo good.  It is never greasy and is consistent every time.

i8Gn97JZ_eIqg2vBi63BPg.text: We ordered take out from Dragon Palace last night. My hubby went to pick it up on his way home from work and it was ready on time. Since this was our first time, we opted for the Mandarin Dinner for 2 so we could try a few things. I have to say that I'm not a huge fan of Chinese food because it tends to be too greasy and salty for me; however, this was Seriously SO delicious! We were pleasantly surprised to see the take out containers packed full. The Mandarin Dinner comes with 2 Egg Rolls and 2 Pork wontons (greasy but that's kind of just how they are - the taste was good tho), Wor Wonton Soup (so delicious) with fried crispies on the side, Mongolian Beef, Sweet and Sour Pork, Pork Fried Rice, 2 Fortune Cookies and 2 Almond Cookies---all for $30! What a great deal! Let's just say we have leftovers for lunch (plus some) today.    I'd never had Wor Wonton Soup before and this was packed full of chicken, shrimp, pork, veggies all in a clear broth and it was so flavorful! I normally add soy sauce (actually I use liquid aminos) but that would have made it too salty. It was perfect just the way it was prepared! This was my favorite dish and definitely ordering that again.  My husband loved the Mongolian Beef - just all beef and green onions in a yummy brown sauce. Lots of beef!!  The Sweet and Sour pork was perfect! Sometimes I order S&S and there's overkill of too many onions, peppers, and pineapple, but not this one! They really focus on delivering you the pork! The only change is next time I'll probably request the sweet and sour sauce on the side because by the time we got it home the pieces in the middle and bottom started getting a little soggy.  The Pork Fried Rice is packed with pork, veggies and eggs. We were very impressed. So yummy!  We will definitely be coming back! :)

5pO-Ov_olSUbUcYMKiBa_Q.text: Been going here since I was in the womb lol. Edward and his family sold it to the new family and we miss them, but he at least sold the recipes to them too. Thank God cause this place is my comfort food. The sizzling rice soup is a fave especially when I'm sick and he gave my husband pick it up for me. The egg drop soup is just as yummy. The food is all amazing... Never eaten anything I didn't love. Nice large backroom for parties.

8PQyqABdpqw5X482HUjWSw.text: New to the area, been looking for a solid Chinese food restaurant, we found it! We've only picked up but definitely want to dine in next time around. Nice to have a awesome Chinese restaurant in the neighborhood, thanks

jowySQQf_S_VEblUR7mNjA.text: Honestly the best Chinese food ever. The egg rolls are to die for and the crab puffs are amazing.

1G40bF5E07lvzQk1gSzxFw.text: I'm a big fan of hot and sour soup, and a bit of a snob about it since I have eaten so much of it. At first I didn't think I would like the soup when it came out because I tend to like broth that is darker and richer looking, and this broth seemed a little light for my tastes (I want a hybrid broth + sauce) but it was delicious! Flavorful and chock full of good things, I was definitely a fan. I also got some fried dumplings that were pretty good, although there's a place in Huntington Beach that makes them just the way I like them and I have yet to find a good replacement, and my brother got a beef dish that he really enjoyed. All in all it was a good experience, very authentic, and the people were nice albeit not overly friendly.

UGLJIv4tnlJ70WfzsG67_A.text: I've been coming here since I was a little girl and nothing ever compares to it. It's a family favorite and always requested by my kids.

aXBIfacyXCpeXI2oTbd2yQ.text: I can't believe this little gem has been practically in our backyard all these years and I've just barely discovered it! Dragon Palace has some of the best Chinese food we've had anywhere in Phoenix. Tonight, we ordered the Mongolian Beef and Szechuan Chicken and were blown away -- delicious! Service was great, and our takeout order was ready in no time. We will certainly be back for more, soon!

jncFaU6GyJB4LdHql4aq1Q.text: Quick service , but nothing write home about.  Food bland, nice portions , but nothing was tasty.  Just...blah...

zvatZJnM-MnVL-f29mdTcw.text: I hadn't been here in years. Had lunch and got the shrimp in lobster sauce and it was delicious. Exceeded expectations for a well priced Chinese restaurant. I'll be back soon to try other menu items. Kungpao shrimp up next, maybe tomorrow. Yum.

qJ7jwKsqN0FNi_6S4O7Yug.text: Went here last month with my friend. We were so hungry! Greeted fast, sat down and a table we got to pick. Order the pou pou platter to start and it was amazing. Consisted of about 5 mini apps and two of each. For example, two spring rolls, 2 teriyaki wings... for dinner my friend got sesame chicken and I got moo shu chicken. Amazing, flavorful and can not wait to come back.

fh4Fz_YMOSdl1_bHAk_ojQ.text: Been eating here for 35 years! Lunch specials are the best. House Special Chicken and Shrimp With Lobster Sauce are favorites!

O8OvnsSEkouYTh9e2h3pWw.text: I've lived in the neighborhood for more than 20 years, and just found this place. Wish I'd of known of it before. The food is consistently delicious. Since we found out that they were right down the street, we have eaten here half a dozen times. Only once were we not overly impressed, and it was a take out order, on a busy night.   Worth trying if you are in the mood for Chinese!

8FJVDhS8N4mrnSIsqqQHMw.text: This is my favorite Chinese restaurant hands down! Winnie is an awesome waitress, very quick and efficient! Will always recommend this place. Thank guys for always giving us an excellent experience!

lMl3U_eTIsW-fdCFn1RDDg.text: We had a craving for Chinese food this Friday evening in Paradise Valley AZ, so we searched the Internet and came up with DRAGON PALACE, and we're glad we did!  We ordered the Peking Dinner for Two, which included Wor Wonton Soup, Pu Pu Platter, entrees of Mongolian Beef and House Special Chicken, with Peking Fried Rice. I also ordered an appetizer of BBQ Sliced Pork.  Even though the restaurant was crowded, service was really fast - our food was delivered quickly, and everything was delicious - and HUGE! We took home several portions. We were surprised when the check came with fortune cookies and 2 delicious honey-coated wonton skins with a banana slice inside, on the House.  Yummy! Definitely recommended.

T4H7IiGEKbJaT0ld3RDKsg.text: We found Dragon Palace thanks to excellent Yelp reviews, and it did not disappoint! It is like a little hidden gem tucked in the deep corner of an almost empty strip mall. We have lived in the neighborhood for several years but never noticed the restaurant as we drove by on 32nd Street. It is a gen worth seeking out for delicious Chinese takeout.   When I called in my order on a Saturday night we were thrilled to hear it would be ready for pickup within 10 minutes--wonderful! The good was ready promptly and was very affordable. We ordered 5 items and were charged less than $50, and had PLENTY of food for our group of 5, with adequate leftovers for the next day. Yum! The Peking Fried Rice was a favorite (so full of delicious meat), as well as the Mongolian Beef (so flavorful).  The decor inside the restaurant is festive and inviting. Best of all, the owners are friendly, professional, and greeted us warmly when we came to pick up the food. Thank you, Dragon Palace! We will be back!

CWzA6ScaqgFpOw2ff1lVOg.text: Food is excellent I'm only giving two stars because they're very pricy compared to other Chinese joints

-bZaEZrTBdHe4f-lny1PoQ.text: If you want solid, consistent plentiful Chinese food in a casual atmosphere this is the place for you.  This is our local go to for Orange Chicken and Szechuan Shredded Pork.  We have been going for years.  The restaurant changed hands a few years back and we worried it would go downhill-but not so!  This family run operation still offers the same quality food and the portions are fabulous.  The Orange Chicken is the BEST anywhere-and they use chicken breast.  They do loads of take-out too.  Try it!

pX0Qs6YhL1PYuXHLLVVb_w.text: So so so good!!  The dinner portions were so much for two people. The wonton soup had everything in more in it including beef, pork, and shrimp. The service was superb as well!!  Definitely will come back again in the future.

4W80h__4jnYdthpmkv5djw.text: This is the BEST Chinese restaurant I've found in the entire United States. Their cherry sauce cannot be duplicated. They egg rolls are perfection. Their Moo Shu Pork is outstanding. Their chicken dishes always hit the spot.   I've been eating here since I was 10 years old and I'm so glad this place is still in business 23 years later. Looking at it from the outside, you might not expect it to be such a hidden gem. But it is!  Great food the bigger chains and trendy Chinese spots just cannot compete with! I LOVE this place!

BoiObY54eMWbbVJCVP-jxA.text: We have been going to this Chinese restaurant for at least 20 years. It is always great. The sweet-and-sour chicken, egg foo young, egg-rolls, soups, honey walnut shrimp your name it, we are always very pleased. I have never had any issues eating, they always get As on their health reports and are even or on the Dean's list!

ZMJakEVD_Opl8qC18WmyKA.text: The lunch special is not too shabby.  We got the sweet and sour chicken and the Mongolian beef.  The sweet and sour wasn't too bad but the Mongolian beef had a ton of oil on the plate and it was really salty.  But, for the price I think it's not bad and they have the lunch special on Saturday's too which is nice.  Most places only have the lunch special during the week only but this place has it for Saturday 12-2, I believe. It's worth a visit, don't let the weird strip mall and the sketchy parking lot scare you off.

im10q6Q9g-_LES-9G6Nddw.text: I have had highs and lows with this place. I think they are the best deal if you go for lunch. the honey walnut shrimp is my favorite their soup is delicious I preferred dining in to take out though I think it's a better deal.

rRRxoJStt5oSgfwdMhVeCw.text: Having moved from Seattle to Phoenix, I ate for many years in the International District and know how good Chinese food is supposed to taste. The Dragon Palace does a great job with most of my favorite dishes!   The A ratings from the County Health Inspector paper the wall when you walk in, inspiring confidence!  Service is quick and accurate.   Our favorites... Wor Wonton Soup crammed with seafood, and wontons. Yummy anytime but especially when you are sick! We always send the other person out to pick this up when we get a cold.  Mongolian Beef is fork tender and the Lo Mein (pan fried soft noodle) dishes are filling and delicious. I don't understand why the AZ Republic food critics don't include this place on their "Best Chinese" list! Tell them to get in there!

photos.caption: Photo of Dragon Palace - Phoenix, AZ, United States

K0sCLWZSKK7vQIcF3udLew.text: This place is a go to staple in the neighborhood... Been going here for years and have never been disappointed... The house special chicken with white meat is what your looking for....

lI8BZztuJ5p_0bABhfi-wQ.text: Arrived at 1:50 p.m. for lunch. We were pointed to a table, given a menu, and told to order fast because they are closing soon (at 2).  At 2:10 they turned off the music and sat near us.  We were so uncomfortable that we left without finishing. That was okay because the Mongolian beef was not very good (not good enough to take home).

POsN-kTzomCt0h3uxucufQ.text: One word, "Awful". Nuff said. I ordered the crispy duck and the honey walnut chicken. Never seen duck and honey walnut chicken look not taste like this. I couldn't believe what they handed me as food. Terrible! This place made Panda Express look like authentic Asian cuisine. My duck was so dry and fatty. The walnut chicken was all lard covered. Ugh I'm getting a stomach ache reliving this awful experience. How this place got four stars is beyond me. I would've given negative stars if it were an option. This place is fuckin nasty bro

photos.caption: Photo of Dragon Palace - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Honey walnut chicken!? Looks like mayonnaise covered chicken. Tasted like it.

c9qMXDUagS1qK8SKR8c7MA.text: My boyfriend and I happened to stumble upon this place while we were across at Joe's Grotto. Little red door just in the corner of the complex, but man was it a great discovery! The food here is superb, reminiscent of the Chinese restaurants we frequented when living in L.A. Food is served quickly along with tea. We always get the Peking Dinner because it's such a great value for how much food you get! There's always enough for lunch the next day and you know that Chinese food is always good the next day!

qSEgWYfv3yUT932L2WEhtQ.text: This place is seriously a hidden gem. If you haven't eaten here, you need to go there, like now. It's been in business for over 30 years from what I've been told.   The staff is incredibly friendly and they WILL remember you the next time you eat there. They treat my wife and I very well every time we are there. It's probably because we had our wedding rehearsal dinner there. That's how much we enjoy this place.   The food is always hot and very tasty. They give you hot tea, and fried wontons every time you eat there and are always very quick with their service. My recommendations are: Mongolian Beef, Sizzling Rice Soup (if you're in the mood for soup), Honey Walnut Shrimp, Happy Family, Shrimp Fried rice...I could go on and on, but they have so many good options.   If you're in the mood for Chinese and want a friendly and quiet place to eat, go to Dragon Palace!

SulbtrgfR2L3qzoi_H70aA.text: Pros: good value for money lots of choices and variety  Very prompt service Owner came by to see if we were having a good experience   Cons :  Location not very appealing  Staff not very friendly.   Had the Dragon Dinner Special. For 2. Mongollian beef, tender beef with scallions, a bit on the bland side but I like spicy, so I fixed it by adding chili oil and all was great. Really good Fried rice. Egg roll and honey chicken wing, all started with work won ton soup.  We also had house special chicken.  Very good.  Will go back.

lDsGC1EiRWvsiefHFD1DpQ.text: Great food and great service! A little sketchy outside but has cool decor inside. Would recommend!

NpKbEUcGsP0zTzqUwy5xHQ.text: The Chinese food was greasy and poorly prepared. The service was worse. Avoid this restaurant.

hMKPbn8ZgjtbSO_2H2SpcQ.text: Huge portions, fairly speedy service. Food is not good though...used to eat here about a decade ago and remember it being so much better. Came back this year and the food was really not good quality, shrimp was overcooked, seasoning wasn't right in the egg rolls or rice, and felt kind of sick after eating it from the oil. Wanted to love it because of the portions and all the little perks like soup and egg rolls, but just wouldn't be able to eat here again.

HtEZBEgtVabAiyVQql8qjg.text: Wonderful service and excellent food!  Everything we've ordered has been great.  Our favorites, include the "Happy Family" (seafood menu), cheese puffs, veggie egg rolls, Mongolian beef, sweet & sour chicken,  fried rice, and garlic chicken.  We feel the portions are generous and the prices very reasonable.  If you haven't tried it, we recommend you do!

LH9RA5BxoNsUtiLi6eHhxQ.text: Best Chinese in Phoenix for real. You MUST try the egg foo young. It is amazing! If you're vegetarian the family bean curd is also delish. The owners are awesome and we always enjoy our visit!!!!

lxVlv1L98P3A2JPaZkY2VQ.text: Decent Chinese food. Not overly impressed.  Ordered a chicken dish house special lots of dark meat chicken deep fried.  Egg drop soup was the best part. Rice ok. Doubt I'll be back.

5jnRgFW4L5gvZoQj243CbQ.text: Best Chinese food around!! Egg foo young, Mongolian beef, Chow Mein, etc. It is all delicious! I won't go anywhere else!

wP0DfczLb1uc7fY1jy08bg.text: We've been going here since i was kid in the early 80's.  a few months ago, i ordered some mong beef for lunch and it was terrible.  i then read an article a few days ago that DPalace received an A+ on their inspection.  So, for nostalgic purposes, i took the fam there for dinner last night.  IT WAS AMAZING.  They definitely redeemed themselves from the last visit.  Dragon Palace is back in my rotation.  the only thing that i wasnt satisfied with is that they changed the recipe of their BoBo Shrimp.  the old recipe was waaay better.  Nonetheless, this a great chinese restaurant and glad to have it in our neighborhood.

ux41lFf7Hc0ukQjH73xewg.text: Good Chinese food. I've had as authentic as you can get and this wasn't bad. Nice staff and lots of choices on the menu.

ei6e0aPFBcVdivSahmhVSg.text: This place isn't bad. It's in a not so great location (tucked in the back corner of a dead shopping plaza) but the food is pretty darned good. You go inside and the decor is loud, yet drab. The walls are painted a striking teal, accompanied with a bright red. Yet it's not very well lit, and the lights look like they  need replacing.   Anyways, we went there for dinner and the service was fast, and the servers were friendly. Our food came out quickly and hot. I really liked the crab puffs. Very good. It was also nice to get free hot tea and water - something I miss about a lot of Phoenix Asian based eateries. The food wasn't too greasy and tasted great. The chicken chow mein tasted a lot like Panda Express, but wasn't nearly as greasy. On average, for this time of day, the avg price for a meal was $10. Appetizers ran the gamut from $2 to $7 (on avg).   I will definitely be adding this to my list of regular haunts.

einSVateJzRjGx3y4HvtCA.text: I have lived in the area for over 4 years and tried this place for the first time tonight.  It was fantastic!  The owners were friendly and the food was delicous and fresh.  I have been searching for a chinese restaurant to call my "regular" place and I think I have found it.  Exceeded my expectations.

hH5KUZPzn9TzzOChmcOHSQ.text: The egg drop is the best!  We have not had one bad meal yet. From start to finish... Darn good

photos.caption: Photo of Dragon Palace - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Deep fried banana in a wonton wrapper yummmmm
Photo of Dragon Palace - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Orange  chicken and house special beef.

FoTWHaiyc7ehzBGP14Qe4w.text: When me and my wife think Chinese food this is the place we go... Always. It's so good and really quick. Never waiting long for your food. Love this place.

iqZOBegOhD-yUI4e69xcEQ.text: Mmmmmmm mmmmm!! Let me just say, I am not a huge fan of Chinese food but this place totally knocks my socks off! Amazing Szechuan chicken, great fried rice and wonderful soup! They even serve hot tea with every meal!! You won't be dissatisfied if you have a craving for good Chinese food! The waitress and waiters are very attentive, your glass will never go empty!! We will be back!

pbRxZ9RQ2KK7O66Btmr2MQ.text: Really good authentic and fresh Chinese food . I like to come for lunch because the food is fresh , good and inexpensive . The portions are big and it comes with tea, egg roll and really good egg drop soup . I took a friend to dragon palace that normally doesn't like Chinese food . He really enjoyed his Kung pao chicken and will be coming back . Great service as well .

QNx4KAmFoEO1VXW2kzaJvg.text: VERY dissatisfied and disappointed with this establishment, I have been going here for a while now and they seem like decent people and the food was decent up until last night when I started eating my food and there was a bunch of egg shell in it, so I didn't eat it, I called and told the owner or manager, his reply was bring the food in from last night and show him the egg shell, are you joking me? Not only have you lost a customer and customers, now you have lost a devoted customer over what, because you didn't want to make a customers order right and basically accuse them of lying? I have spent countless money, hard earned money in your inflated priced establishment and now you have lost it over an order of chicken fried rice lol what a disgrace!

v3ZCksPC-DWQs1M0DHev8w.text: Take out is quick and always super hot! Their orange chicken is superb! Would recommend this place to anyone!

qibm2sK6QNC1gyzhJ2zfmg.text: This place is delicious!!  I have been here a couple of times. Tonight was the first time I ordered take out.  My food was ready in 10 minutes!  They packaged it up with care and added a round cookie and a sugar cookie. I ordered the orange chicken and the crab Rangoon. Both where super delicious. I have plenty left over!!  The orange chicken had nice size pieces of juicy chicken breast lightly breaded and not overly spicy.  I do love the decor in here!!  It's quirky but that's what makes it cool!  The only bummer about take out is you don't get the wonderful banana wontons everyone raved about but I'm sure they'd throw it in if you asked!!  Love this place!!

PTRfvzaQq78FK1oGB_9eMg.text: Dragon Palace is the place I am most likely to go in the Valley for Chinese food.  It is close to my house, has a good atmosphere, friendly staff and good food.  The restaurant is standard Chinese American fare.  My personal favorite is the Mongolian Beef which is always made perfect with scallions and white rice.  Egg rolls are tasty as is the egg drop soup.  The meals always come with the traditional hot tea and end with a fortune cookie.  The atmosphere is old school with booths around the walls and tables within the room.     If you are looking for a decent Chinese restaurant with good food and no surprises, you have come to the right place.

QF43pybJ5OcRH8S-IpvcMQ.text: I love this place!  Overall, their food is great and the lunch specials are a real bargain. The staff is polite and attentive and won't leave you waiting for much, The complimentary hot tea is excellent. I make it to dragon palace for lunch whenever I can.  The interior of this place is something else.  the walls are red and turquoise with gigantic  reliefs of Chinese themes scenes.  Its a family run business and not everybody speaks English, so be prepared to order by letter on the men

XKyNCyxAei3fl4pq8HDMyQ.text: FIRST TIME HERE.  The place is in a beat up shopping complex.  Nothing scary- just old.  The inside was lovely for a Chinese restaurant.  Loved the hanging lanterns and the dark red seats and all the gold wood wall hanging which displayed various Chinese dragons.  It felt like a restaurant in china-town (but clean).  Bath rooms probably need a good in the cracks cleaning--- but overall it was clean.  (The kindof clean you want a restaurant bathroom to be in... get my drift?)  Best crab puffs in the area! Yum, you get 8 cream cheese filled pffs for 4.95.  The egg drop soup ($4.00 for a large) was flavorful and really thick--- a little too thick for my preference and full of celery.  My husband raved about it, thought it was the best ever.  We also ordered the Sizzling Rice Soup ($7.25 for a large), would've been knocked out of the park with flavor, ingrediants, however, the cook added too much salt.  Kids ordered a large egg fried rice sans the peas/carrots.  It had a great buttery/bacony flavor to it.  Wow--- so good.  Our entree was the Honey Walnut Shrimp for $11.95.  Shrimp tasted fresh, no funky flavored shrimp.  The sauce was light and when I say "light"  it was tossed perfectly.  Shrimp to sauce ratio was spot on.  The shrimp was lightly battered, no tempura shrimp here.  The walnuts came a little light, could've used a little more but it was about 15 large shrimps on the platter.  They priced it right for what you got.  It's your standard American chinese food.   Will definitely be back.  It was good..... if my soup wasn't so salty I probably would've given it 4 stars.  I"m thinking this was even 3.5 star establishment.

a8bzqobmEdwYhiVEUDjpIA.text: The food was passable. The dining room was nearly empty at 7 pm on a weeknight. Not that I crave a crowded and noisy dining experience, but it would've been nice to think we'd made the right choice eating there by seeing other diners voting with their wallets.  I don't think our waitress spoke any English beyond what was on the menu. She had to go get help from another waitress when I ordered a whiskey on the rocks. Even the more fluent of the two didn't think to ask me what kind of whiskey, so I was served rail that tasted like the ice cubes had come from a moldy dispenser.  The food was ok. Nothing special. I had the kung pao chicken. It lacked spice and came loaded with onions (which I had asked them to leave out).

bPfjZE-MTK7q34472p99Fg.text: Slightly greasy overall, but very delicious, particularly the vegetable dishes.  The meats are fine, but the Awesome Wor Wonton soup really has me crawling back for more.  The moo shu pork is great, but the vegetarian version would probably be fine too.  Service is great - while English fluency is not exactly impressive, it's clear that most of the employees are very careful to provide polite service with many "Thank you, thank yous".  I didn't really eat much Chinese food since I started eating healthier, but I'm glad I tried this place.  We've gone back 2-3 times now, and when people ask me where I go for Chinese food, I'm enthusiastic about recommending this place.

0u9cATHKqO3NA1WTobXPzQ.text: I love eating here. Not only is their food delicious, the staff is soo welcoming every time. I drive 40 minutes to eat here and I'm never disappointed. (:

Q4gsBxH9ME0rPfYl5bsO0w.text: The food here is usually pretty good.  It's a pretty standard Chinese food restaurant.  The service is another matter entirely.  We've dined in on a few occasions and it just seems like overall, they are annoyed to be there.  Last night we ordered takeout for Valentine's day.  They stated 25 minutes for the order when I called it in.  I showed up 30 minutes later and the lobby was packed full of people.  There was no rhyme or reason to any of it.  Food was coming out and just sitting on the table.  They were not calling out names.  Just arbitrarily taking whoever fought their way to the counter first and hoping their food was ready.  They kept taking phone calls and every person was told 20-25 minutes, even though clearly, it was taking longer than than.  In all, it was an hour and 15 minutes from the time I called until I left with my food.  To top it off, the food was fairly bland and unremarkable.

gwngcCA4e4lH30NPIJ1Xag.text: We drive all the way from the east valley to come here. It's the only good place we have found for Chinese. We would recommend it to anyone!

Q34PiNwlbPIwK0UxZr8JYA.text: This place is a treasure in an unassuming and mostly empty shopping center. But, it's fantastic. May be the best egg roll I've ever had - and I consider myself an egg roll critic. PoPoPlatter was great all around.

ibLeQHqRcXkSv9wXO-T_JA.text: We have gotten take out from here a few times and tried several dishes and never been disappointed.  Its definitely a step above any other chinese take out place in the area.

mh5imhRVwaYnZWzAXYf3qg.text: Surprisingly beautiful restaurant in a rather run down location. Don't let it throw you. We've been taking carry out for some time and have never been disappointed. Their Peking dishes, soups and egg rolls are delicious. Their hot mustard is always spot on and brings out the head sweat. And how do they get so much food in those little boxes?

zCxop_fvxqkfLOH0rWpfbA.text: I really wanted to like this place.  Really I did. The Yelp reviews were good, so I decided to give it a try.  When I came to pick up our order, the hostess at the front was very nice and there were many people in the restaurant.  I brought the order home, and it was all correct. I like the fact they put each container in a little plastic bag to cut down on leaks and spills. Plus they give you almond cookies and fortune cookies with your order.  But the food. Ugh! Unfortunately, it examples the worst of Americanized Chinese food. None of our four dishes - Mongolian beef, cashew chicken, kung pao chicken and house fried rice - really had any flavor, except the beef, which tasted of flour.  So disappointing! Won't be going back. One star for being pleasant and one for the packaging and almond cookies. That's it.

IDw8THE9-s5atFOJGrNcCw.text: We spent almost $85 on take out for the family, and to be honest I was very disappointed.  Let me give a run down. I ordered over the phone and told them when I wanted to pick it up. It was ready to go, We ordered BBQ Pork Appetizer- very dry and over cooked Veg Chow Mein - A lot of vegetables laying on top not mixed in and the pasta was mushy Mixed Veggies -(snow peas, bamboo shoots, Black mushrooms) not what I expected, could be my fault, the mushrooms were like rubber. Are all black mushrooms like that? Lemon Chicken- sauce was good but the chicken was a fried breast sliced up and it was very dry Mongolian Beef - ok a little bland Pork fried rice - good Egg Rolls- good Fried Dumplings - my six year old liked them.  Ya Shan Beef- the best thing we ordered only half of which will be good for leftovers.  I don't think I will be going back.

y-gOPA6tdOez15_XsYVyJw.text: This place rocks.   The house chicken is great.   Kids love the noodles.   Awesome little diveyy Chinese place with amazing food. It reminds me of the one my mom used to take us to when we were little kids.

yeBrx8uuLHibrqytzSlmVQ.text: Chinese has always been a bit of a tricky cuisine for me to review. Admittedly, this is partially due to my own ignorance, thanks to my parents excluding Chinese from the five or six restaurants we kept in continuous rotation during family dinner outings. It also has a lot to do with the fact that Chinese food, at least the American-influenced style we're most familiar with, hasn't really evolved much. Yes, there are corporate chains that suburban families flock to, as well as these so-called "modern" spots that simply replace the dragon decor with IKEA furnishings and big screen TVs. But is the food really all that different? When you think about it, pizza, burgers, and even Mexican food all have their fair share of changes over the years. But I rarely see or hear about any "high-end" Chinese restaurants, nor have I found much variation in the types of food available. It's all pretty traditional stuff, which is probably why its once exotic appeal has slowly waned in the last fifty years. The fact that roughly one-third of them are always named "The Great Wall" doesn't help matters much.   Wait, where was I? Oh, yes. Dragon Palace. A little family-owned Chinese restaurant that, from what I understand, has been around for quite some time. Located in a seedy looking plaza, it was one of the few Chinese places that popped up with some decent Yelp reviews, so I thought we'd give them a try.  Hey, complimentary tea upon being seated? Nice touch!  My girlfriend and I ordered a sampler platter, which consisted of two wontons, honey dipped chicken legs, egg rolls, and jumbo fried shrimp. Unfortunately, the wontons tasted stale, as if they had been sitting around for far too long. The egg rolls weren't too far off. In my opinion, these are the basic of the most basic items - and if something is wrong with them, that's probably not a good sign. Hell, if the Vietnamese and Thai crew, people that shamefully stole these items from the Chinese menu can do them right, why can't this place?  Our entrees were delivered shortly thereafter, quickly slapped down on the edge of the table by the server - similar to a barista plunking down a couple of iced coffees on the counter before running back to make another drink during the middle of a mad rush.  Typically, when I eat Chinese, I usually play it safe by ordering beef and broccoli and rarely deviate out of sheer fear. However, for once, I attempted to change things up by ordering their Kung Pao Chicken. I took about three bites and immediately surrendered. I still can't put my finger on what it was, but something, whether it be the peanuts, or some kind of strange oyster-like sauce, just gave the meat this very bizarre aftertaste that I strongly disliked.  My girlfriend ordered the chicken chow mein. Half was offered to me out of pity, due to my immediate dismissal of my Pao. It wasn't too bad, but nothing that I would order for myself. Once again, I can't really put my finger on why, it just seemed rather bland.  You also receive the traditional bowl of rice. Eh - rice is rice. I can make it in my microwave in six minutes, but it's there if you want it.  They serve a couple of complimentary banana fritters at the end of the meal, which I'll admit, was a charming move - especially since most Chinese restaurants don't seem too big on offering desserts. They were okay, but probably would have tasted better hot, as fried bananas typically do. Then again, they were free, so I guess I shouldn't complain.  Overall, I was not really impressed, which really now has me wondering who serves the best Chinese food in Phoenix. Allegedly, according to my girlfriend, the best Chinese restaurants are actually found in Mexico of all places - a belief that a colleague of mine also strongly supports. From what I've been reading, there's actually a quiet movement in Central Phoenix to give Chinese cuisine a bit of a boost - although I haven't quite experienced this just yet.  Ultimately, this just wasn't my type of place. Although reading some of the reviews, they seem to have their fair share of longtime fans, so take my opinion with a grain of salt - or in this case, a grain of MSG.

cTW05Z0Og4NzBDY0IZgVDQ.text: I'm normally a big fan but tonight my sweet and sour chicken was dry with very little sauce. I only found one piece of pineapple. I was disappointed.

qvaLpSwSwJDGnlKQ81j7kg.text: The first time I ordered take out from this place, it was DELICIOUS! I couldn't of asked for more.  I ordered again last night for the second time (also take out) and I was very disappointed. We were shorted some white rice, the Sesame Chicken was very dry, and the little bit of sauce that was at the bottom had a large layer of drippy oil on top. There was also an egg shell in my Egg Drop Soup. The Special Beef item was just O-K. My boyfriend said he wasn't impressed how the beef was cooked, as it was too chewy. Really thought I found the best Chinese place near me, but apparently this is not the case!

Dd9kSlNOS_2xnzUig15u1w.text: I think I have found my favorite Chinese restaurant in Phoenix! Dragon Palace is everything I think of when it comes to Chinese food. The restaurant is full of traditional decorations and of course those large red booths. (They have tables too). Soft Chinese music playing in the background and some artwork.   Let's move on to the food...Dragon Palace has Mandarin and Szechuan dishes. The food is so good that I came in two weeks in a row.   We started with fried meat dumplings and crab puffs. Oh both are delicious and served with sweet and sour and hot chili sauces. We also had sizzling rice soup. One of the best Chinese soups I have ever had with chicken, shrimp and veggies. They also bring out complimentary fried wonton strips with dipping sauce to every table.   For dinner we had house special chicken which is lightly fried chicken breast sauteed in "special sauce". I don't know what this special sauce is, but I would drink it if I could. Yummy!  We also tried the sauteed happy family which is chicken, beef, shrimp, scallops and Chinese veggies all together covered in a brown sauce. Delicious! The brown sauce has a great flavor and is slightly sweet. They also don't skimp on any of the meat or seafood. I was impressed!   We did not try dessert, but they bring out complimentary banana wontons covered in honey with the check. Oh these are good!! Can I have more than one please!?  Another thing to mention is the full bar. When I go out for Chinese food I never think of ordering a cocktail. Dragon Palace had a pretty impressive cocktail menu. I didn't have a cocktail, but several people in the restaurant did and the drinks looks really good. I'll be sure to try one next time!  Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Dragon Palace - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Traditional Chinese decor!

4o79ArZBttuczvy__4stKQ.text: Wife and I went yesterday at noon. I had General Chow's chicken and it was very good. So many other reviewers refer to restaurants cuisine as being authentic. Don't know what expertise they have in labeling food authentic but this was good. Would happily go again.

6-8bTSaHc5Be9ikm-DJM5g.text: The food here is dog shit. Not sure why this place got 4 out of 5 stars. Hope my family and I don't die of food poisoning or the shits. So disappointed .

M8cVrOK9zfQZbSrOIxstog.text: All I can say is if you need to prepare for a colonoscopy or don't mind throwing up all night this is the place for you!

DG7PbWvBh1Lcs4W4QA5hMQ.text: Would have preferred to just go to Panda Express. Seemed a little sketchy.  Food wasn't great. Chow Mein was okay. King Pao chicken looked very off.

65fCD05K2J3zMeZTY-P0bQ.text: We have been going here for years!  Crave the Mongolian Beef!! The service is terrific and we always run into someone we know!!! We have recommended many people over the years and never hear a complaint.  Thank you Dragon Palace!

A_9SfzKBDgEuQGp24Xw6zQ.text: Food was great. The sizzling rice soup was awesome. The egg rolls were just okay. My wife and I shared vegetable fried rice and bobo shrimp. Great dishes, great service, food was served quick, hot, and fresh.

Photo of Dragon Palace - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ikFPenQArIzZtcpZHtrNCQ.text: Me and my boyfriend were craving some Chinese food, so I yelped the closest location with the best reviews. This one popped up and I'm glad it did. I never really expect too much going to a hole in the wall Chinese restaurant, but this place was good.  We ordered the cream cheese wontons for an appetizer. They came out fast and were fresh! Also, was a big serving.  We came during lunch so we received egg drop soup before our meal as well.  I had the sesame chicken while my boyfriend had the orange chicken. Both were tasty! And again came with a lot of food. Lot of the chicken, fried rice, an egg roll, and two wontons.  Lots of good food and a check of $20. Yes please!  Good place if you're hungry and on a budget.

photos.caption: Photo of Dragon Palace - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tasty cream cheese wontons
Photo of Dragon Palace - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Orange chicken, yummmm also!

w9amtUCq5w8DF3OCjsXJ2w.text: Hubby and I have lived less than 5 miles from this place for over 20 years and never stopped in.  Looking for good Chinese so yelped the area and Dragon Palace popped up with good reviews.  Comments about the outside are right - little corner spot in dated strip mall but who cares if the food is good....and it was!  We ordered three lunches to try out different dishes.  Both of us loved the egg rolls along with the sweet n sour chicken and the house chicken.  Not as thrilled with the beef and brocolli - nothing special on that dish so will stick with the chicken next time....and there will be a next time!  Don't be fooled by the outside - step in and try the food - you'll be back.

iodArDHAF85st4g1XtH7-w.text: Do try the Sizzling Rice Shrimp.  It is divine.  Now my husband wants to go there any time we want Chinese.  Yum!

36HkEH9yj2Q5rD_lwFkn_A.text: Dragon Palace is fantastic. The staff is friendly and the food is excellent.  The potstickers are to die for and the chili dipping sauce is amazing!

CWvqKZg8kScXiSXDtEGfkg.text: Love this place! We've lived close by for years - passing by it so many times - but never ate here. Until last year. My brother read the reviews on Yelp and suggested it. It sooo reminded me of our favorite Chinese restaurant in CT. I love the Bo Bo Chicken. Its a little spicy with a very taste sauce. As others have mentioned, the House Special Chicken rocks! I found it tasted better when served at the restaurant. As take-out, it was a little dry. I've also found that most of the menu items that are labeled "highly recommended" are usually really good. Oh and for starters, the War Won Ton Soup is amazing! My only complaint is that the don't de-vein the shrimp! I've tried several shrimp dishes, including the War Won Ton Soup, and found the shrimp to still have the vein intact! Personally, that is not appealing to me so I don't order shrimp there. But truly everything else is wonderful. The service is also very good. Give it a try!

xxQwAbBcuTKNgcyjnZ4wAA.text: Entertained family who frequent the upscale House of Louie in West Covina, CA to the ultimate value...Chinese lunch.  I used to patronize Dragon Palace in 1979 when I first moved here and half the subsequent decade because 1) it was only one of a few  decent places in the vicinity and 2) it was damn good food, and still is in my estimation.  What a treat...why haven't I been back more often over the last few years?    One big let down at other places has been my former favorite, sweet and sour pork, as chewy, gristly over cooked lumps covered in gooey coating.  DP nailed it with tasty chunks of pork wrapped in a crispy tempura type batter...heavenly.  This large lunch for only $5.95 has lit a fire under me to remember to use this place a lot more now.  The only thing we need now is help from you advertising geniuses  to suggest signage to get people to pay heads-up attention and find the delicacies hiding in the back corner!

UE2xt3XFpa0cXDJX1iUC6A.text: Great food and attentive servers! This place was a fantastic choice for a midweek dinner. Everything we ordered was tasty and fresh! Definitely recommended for all... my 7 year old granddaughter enjoyed her mea, especially the wontons they brought at the end for dessert.

igY6n50vj7MWkoB5QsQDEQ.text: Our go-to for Chinese take out used to be Nee House. But as the years went by, their portions got smaller and their prices got higher. So it was time to find another restaurant.  Little did we know this AMAZING place was so close to our house! The great reviews online convinced us to try it.  The owner takes pride in all their dishes and goes overboard to please the customer.  Their ingredients are SO fresh. And the sauces are super-flavorful. All the meats are moist -- and that's hard to do with chicken. No matter what you order, you will be happy!  We will never go back to NH. We are Dragon Palace fans forever. And we've spread the word to everybody we know.

Qsob2pSBwk8RgNAurrxS-w.text: DRAGON PALACE!  30 years in the same spot.  The best Chinese in town hands down. Hot and Sour soup, Mandarin Hot Beef, Mu Shu Pork, Garlic Shrimp. A+

SS1Wr6pyGnmKLIq74YxfAw.text: This is our favorite Chinese restaurant. The food is delicious and the price is right. They are fast and always quite friendly.

cfjEK_D2hhw640c2xd-bMQ.text: Good eats ilove it go go go?

srIf1EAVNybsfNofw4B3Bg.text: First off....I'm a rabbit! This according to every Chinese Zodiac.  I like being a rabbit. My opposite.....the cock! My wife apparently is a cock. So for eighteen years I have loved .....well, my Wife!   Dragon Palace has been around for a VERY long time. I remeber going there as a child and loving it. One of my daughters has been in gymnastics just west of this restaurant and I keep wanting to eat here again and I continually drive by without stopping. My family generally eats at Nee-House or Jade Palace but the nostalgia here had my curiousity piqued.   This past weekend I made an executive choice. "Family" I said, "We are going to Dragon Palace tonight for dinner" I was so excited. This was going to be a huge throwback to my childhood. So we arrive and so goes!  We walk up to two Chinese Red colored doors. I remember these doors being gigantic, not so big anymore when you are 6' tall. I open the door for my family to enter and the wonderfull smell wafed by my nose. Just the smell I remember, a True chinese smell. When we entered there was an old Chinese man at the front counter. I wonder if he was here 25 years ago? The lanterns adorned the rooftop just like I remember back in the eighties. Pink and blue hues were splashed on the walls. No frills, just the iconic, eclectic and stereotypical Chinese joint. So far everything is great. Now the food has to be good. And it was. I must say I was peased big time. I am a very adventurous eater usually. NOT TONIGHT. I wanted simple traditional Americanized chines fair and they hit on all levels. Wor Wonton Soup, Egg Foo Yung, Mongollion Beef, Orange Chicken, Low Mein (house), Crab Puff and Egg Rolls. Easy comfort stuff. It was very good, very fresh.   Dragon Palace always served a "treat" at the end of the meal. Ice Cream usually. Now it appears they serve a new and even better treat after the meal. Get this, Banana, wrapped in wonton skin, deep fried and drizzled with honey. Crispy, Chewy, Golden and sweet. Those little chats are off the map. Loved it and we will be back soon!!!

T_BZn_qC8-pILp_H1FomiQ.text: So glad to have found this place hidden in a dive of a strip mall (aren't all  places in strip malls in Phx?). Hey, it allowed me to finally find Joe's Grotto too.  Dragon Palace provides quick, thorough, and friendly service. Very well packaged to-go orders that keep you from having sauce spill out all over your car. I've tried a few dishes and found that they can sometimes be a bit bland, but overall it's quality Chinese food. I happen to be addicted to the Mu Shu Pork. I was surprised they wrap the crepes before packaging, but it really seems to allow the flavors to blend together and they're just plain good.  I had been really disappointed with not being able to find a decent Chinese takeout place in Phoenix and Dragon Palace is just what the doctor ordered!

C-5pvooIuHk907olApDZ1Q.text: One step above a hole in the wall buffet place.  Food was edible.  Very bland, service was very un-attentive and my egg roll was soggy to boot.  I'll take my money elsewhere.

7WsHnwRfpDS6kaiIxbZrCA.text: Food here was just ok, and I'm pretty sure they are using MSG still. Every dish (including the house special chicken over which everyone was raving) was heavily salted and just plain bland tasting. Three stars awarded for quick and attentive service and reasonable prices. But I won't be returning.

4kfYo6P0RE4RBK6dezoVeg.text: I wish I could give this place 6 stars.  By far the best chinese food in Phoenix in my opinion and the staff is super friendly.  I love finding local places like this instead of the souless PF Changs and Pei-Weis.  The candied banana won-tons are the best!

0Ps1xwHNYSSne355vt3d_Q.text: Like everyone has said... It is in a crapy location. The food was ok, again like others said SALTY! You almost need to take a diuretic when you get home. They will not substitute anything for you. The first and probably only time there, I got the lunch combo and asked if I could substitute the hot and sour soup for the egg drop. The Asian man started screaming, "no subtooshin, no subtooshin, it say no subtooshin". I'm thinking damn, it was only a request. I said "ok", then he starts in with "hot sour soup very special, feed 6 people, has lots of stuff in it". I said ok, and he again said "I no subtoot, you get soup". Ok. Kinda funny when I look back at it. Maybe that is why it was me and one more table for lunch.

Ez6Ug4-4ekpLyEH-4v8fsA.text: Love this place! The staff is so friendly and the food is fantastic! We live about 4 miles away and it is definitely our go to Chinese place.

fCzNYs3VjHhAhyIkgxKVUg.text: Visited Dragon Palace while visiting my daughter in Phoenix.  Service was quick and courteous.  Food was okay, nothing spectacular.  Not the best I've had, but definitely not the worst I've ever had.  I would come back here again for a safe meal when I'm in the mood for Chinese food in Phoenix.

PBWdlKuZaNIT2DE-f1EQJA.text: I tried this place out all because of Shane's ROTD and yep it lived up to its greatness. I ordered a appetizer platter, twice cooked pork and pork fried rice. (Apparently I was craving pork which is beyond rare) Man all of the food was really good. The egg rolls were stuffed with yummy goodness, the honey chicken was finger-licking good, there was TONS of pork fried rice packed into that container. My goodness was it stuffed. The only disappointment was the twice cooked pork. Don't get me wrong it was good, but when I ask for extra, extra spicy, that is exactly what I am expecting and it fell short. :(  But will it stop me from going back,? heck no. I am already thinking about what I will be ordering this coming weekend.

V_qC-F7SbEfoktdSI-LWWA.text: House special chicken is a must. This is not a fancy schmancy place so you know the food will be good! Never have had to wait for a table. The banana thingies they give you for dessert are awesome too. I give it 5 stars because of the huge selection. Pei Wei and PF Changs are ok but they have a limited menu. And a LARGE wait!

F4uA_GbQ9_0FLgve_lvpLA.text: Probably one of the better Chinese places Ive tried. I love take out and delivery Chinese for some reason, this place was great to eat in. Would highly recommend eating here.

TKgJD755aFayoqYyx-iu0A.text: I LOVE Dragon Palace. I have been going here for about 16 years.  It is your average looking neighborhood, family owned chinese restaurant. They have crazy lanterns and blue walls inside.  The staff is always very friendly and helpful.  They will make recomendations and help you out with ordering.  Lunch is awesome...you can order from a list of about 15 dishes and it comes with rice, wantons, and an eggroll all for about 9 bucks.  Dinner is great too...portions are large and perfect for sharing.  I would definetly recommend this place.

KURWfLUVMpOwpvxRitk5vA.text: This is by far my favorite Chinese restaurant in the valley. I am not a particular fan of egg rolls, but theirs are certainly the best I have ever had. Their lunch specials are great and you can get out of there for under 7 dollars during lunch.  The only thing that could be better is the location, but to be quite honest I would rather it be where its at with the current prices.

zeX8LKU6pGlR9uEpQ5MABQ.text: So I'm not a big Chinese food fan, but my husband is. Truth be told, it usually makes me sick. But if I were to go to Chinese food, Dragon Palace would be one of the places that I would go. The food is decent and there's a lot of it. I really felt I was getting my value's worth.  The waitstaff was attentive (always there asking if I wanted a refill) and the food came out quickly. It looks like every other Chinese food restaurant in the world (lots of red and gold, lanterns, paper Chinese Horoscope place mat -- save for the deep teal walls).  I'm not sure I would make a long drive to Dragon Palace because chances are you have a comparable Chinese food restaurant nearby, but if you live in the 32nd St. and T-Bird vicinity, this is certainly a Chinese food place worth trying.   As for the food, we ordered the Peking dinner for 2 which came with won ton soup, a pu pu platter (consisting of won tons - yum -, eggroll, a small fried shrimp, a skewer of glazed beef and honey chicken), Peking fried rice (fried rice with shrimp, chicken, pork and beef), Mongolian beef and the house chicken. (as an aside and a disclaimer, I am preggers right now and I have developed a severe dislike for chicken which means I, of course, hated the chicken dishes). My husband thought it all was ok. I really liked the won ton soup and the Peking fried rice. After dinner, we got the requisite fortune cookie ("Express yourself now." WHAT?) and a really yummy banana wrapped in a won ton and fried with a sugar glaze thing.  All in all, it was a good time at a pretty good Chinese Food Restaurant.

CxgkjlaSgKINuGU-HhUYTg.text: Eh, it definitely wasn't as good as some people write about. I did take-out...kinda pricey if you ask me. When I walked in there was a big mix up in the orders so it took a minute to pay for my food and get out of there. The chow mein was good. Fried rice was good. But nothing really stuck out as amazing. I don't think I'll be back anytime in the near future.

Wyc3CW5TGiExtVBd8nqx8A.text: I can't believe I never knew this gem was here!  After 13 years in the neighborhood! I found Dragon Palace on Yelp and ordered take out for my sick husband. Sizzling rice soup with hot mustard always does the trick when you have a cold or flu.   Although the inside is dark and outdated, the smell as you walk in the door let's you know this place is amazing!  Truly the best Chinese food in the valley!  We will definitely be back, sooner than later!

QtH_SAbm6B_GGtYajoCRfg.text: Well, it was a good thing we showed up right at opening on Christmas Eve! Tracked this place down via Yelp reviews and it is a tradition to have Chinese this evening. We were seated right away (can't say that for the masses that showed up within the hour after us) and ur server took our drink orders right away, although you'd think it was the first time she'd ever waited a table before. Thankfully, my brother is a waiter so he helped her keep track of what we wanted. Unfortunately, receiving our meal took FOREVER. On a positive note, it was a TON of food and generally pretty tasty. We tried various fried rice plates, chicken chow mein, beef and broccoli and assorted vegetables. Again, pretty good but that might be helped by the fact that we were starving by the time it showed up. They did their best on an extremely busy night, but they need some professional organization assistance or guidance.

7KYGyUfj69xfzWIapZV0lA.text: I loved the egg foo young. Huge portions. Delicious food. Super yummy and looked good too.

RGh3PgI4MfwhYmZmaN4OIQ.text: I hadn't been here in years when it was owned by the prior owner.  What a fantastic dinner we had!  The place hasn't changed that much physically, that is, still the bright red walls along the bright turquoise ones.  This place is the stereotype of chinese restaurants.  But, boy oh boy has the food changed.  The food was incredible.   We started with egg drop soup, hearty and delicious at a mere $2.00  It had tofu in it too.  I had the shredded pork with brown rice (1.00 add on).  It was a huge portion but more importantly, delicious.  The other dish was a beef dish (name? ) Shi- something.  Large, large and delish, delish.   Prices are super reasonable and service is attentive. I will be coming back soon.  This place is giving great food with great pricing.  You can't get that in Scottsdale.

photos.caption: Photo of Dragon Palace - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Egg drop soup with noodles and free tea. When was the last time they gave u free tea at a restaurant.
Photo of Dragon Palace - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Scheuwan pork. Cant wait to try it.
Photo of Dragon Palace - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Moo goo gai pan extra spicy. Look at that portion of yummyness.

3AmAwAXCwt4pOBQkW5xOvw.text: I've driven by this place 100+ times and finally decided to try it. Sooo glad I did! The food is really high quality, has great flavor, and it's clean inside. They even post all their health reports by the register where you pick up orders. The man who helped me was nice.  The orange chicken was crispy, has nice sized chicken inside, very tasty.  Egg rolls were delicious.  Crab puffs were filled generously and had excellent flavor.  The beef fried rice was to die for - perfect balance of oil and "bounce", just right.  I highly recommend this spot for your classic American-Chinese restaurant that has good quality, tasty food.

Zxja9WjSdqsBG5mRzkHHJw.text: I have eaten there for years, however the last time I had takeout it was by far the worst Chinese food that I have ever eaten in my life. I just cannot believe that a restaurant that used to be so good is now serving terrible food.

MuGe1mo3lqdfccKTViFzYQ.text: This was the best Chinese food I've eaten in a long time.  It reminded me of real local Hawaiian style Chinese food.  I highly recommend this restaurant. The service was great. The restaurant was clean. They have a full bar!   The prices are very reasonable and the food was delicious!

rbhNZVUc7qU6wwjYWmXicQ.text: I was pleasantly surprised! From the outside Dragon Palace isn't very appealing and the inside is old and dingy but the customer service is great and the food is pretty good. I would it give it a full 5 stars because I'm SUPER picky on Chinese but it is a pretty solid 4 food wise. Don't let the outside deter you.

zR3ap90A0kdwOGWvOAJQqQ.text: Definitely a hidden gem.  Learned that this restaurant has been at this location for 43 years. The current owners Ken and Winnie are so  pleasant and accommodating.  Options are vast and the food was wonderful.  We shared the Honey Walnut Shrimp and the Beef with Snow Peas. Both dishes were the best I've ever had.  A must try! Wish they delivered.

_BHtjx4m6A6E9MJDE-pzXQ.text: We've gone here twice and liked it much better the first time compared to last night. Service is odd. Both times the servers were abrupt and it feels like they just throw cups and plates in front of you. Last night they also brought soup and food at once which made us feel rushed.   Our first visit, we tried wor wonton soup, kung pao, and walnut shrimp--it was all pretty good, and flavorful though the kung pao seemed to be only peanuts and chicken. I'd give it 4 stars. Last night we came back for the soup and tried a few appetizers.  Everything was fine, but generally lacked flavor (except the honey chicken wings which were GREAT).  Throw in the service, and we're just not sure we'll come back...

gHKwoKKOYUOURl2W43sE8w.text: Great sizzling rice soup but the chicken and broccoli and Mongolian beef was just terrible. The beef tasted like nasty seafood and the chicken was rubber.

jJgfWwmLw1yfsZ4mjSuNbQ.text: Ordered take-away and we were not disappointed. They make a great hot mustard (not the crappy kind that is in a packet). We got a chicken & noodle dish, beef & broccoli, egg rolls, crab puffs and fried wings. The only thing I thought really needed improvement was the fried wings. This was my first time ordering from this place so I'm not sure if I didn't order correctly or what. I usually get these and they have a sauce on them but these were just plain without any type of sauce (maybe you need to add a sauce?). It was still a good meal; fed 3 people dinner and then lunch the next day too so about $6-7/meal. I'd go again if in the area.

OnOb0ydNGMsB_eG5jqxjXw.text: Portions were huge. Service great. Will definitely go back. In the corner of an app unassuming strip mall. Gave a sweet fried banana at the end. This place rocks. Had enough for 2 days easily.
